result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence D Shelton III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered. Bail on deposit, if any to apply. Remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for Huber and electronic monitoring.

Defendant Clarence D Shelton in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Clarence D Shelton in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Count 2 was dismissed and read in on the last court date.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 20 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clarence D Shelton in court with Attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
